ygData.subject: Re: Bard Revenge
ygData.msgSnippet: ... No, I don t see anything wrong with this picture. There was a druid AND a cleric. A cleric CAN use a BI crown (uh oh! acronym!). Both of the people were
ygData.messageBody:
> > crown. We were the only two people in the zone. In comes a
> > L28 druid and a L25 cleric, who decide they also want the
> > warlord. They however, were not willing to take turns
>
> Do you see something wrong with this picture? Druids can't
> even *use* the BI crown. While I don't want to dredge up the
> twinking topic, I see stuff like this happening way too often,
> and it's why I feel so strongly about it.

No, I don't see anything wrong with this picture. There was a druid AND a
cleric. A cleric CAN use a BI crown (uh oh! acronym!). Both of the people
were appropriate level.

I think you see it happening so much because you're constantly looking for
it where it probably doesn't exist. Unless, of course, ever helping anyone
in your group get anything is twinking (even though you're both of the
appropriate level).

> > Warlord spawns, and I easily charm it. The druid casts
> > lightning 7 times on a charmed warlord, and manages one
>
> I thought lightning was an outdoors-only spell?

Careless Lightning, a druid's L19 DD spell is not outdoor only. It maxes
out at 99 dmg and is what a druid has to fall back on from L19-L48 when
fighting in Solusek A or B.
